title: Drawing, Design for a Chandelier, ca. 1830
medium: pen and black ink, brush and yellow-brown, green-blue watercolor, graphite on paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Design for a chandelier. On top is a kind of crown, to which five chains are fastened. One row of burning candles, nine are shown. They stick in sockets at the end of arms, which are fastened to the ring. The arms end there as heads of snakes, in which are candles of glass with an extinguisher on top. The central part of the chandelier is a bowl with a body of a diamond glass upon a metal foot. Many drops and other ornaments of glass. Below is the scale.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Design for a Chandelier, ca. 1830; Germany; pen and black ink, brush and yellow-brown, green-blue watercolor, graphite on paper; 42.8 × 29.5 cm (16 7/8 × 11 5/8 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund; 1938-88-724
